com.kuka.roboticsAPI.safetyModel

Interface IControllerSafety

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ISafetyStateProvider<ControllerSafetyState>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    SunriseControllerSafety

    public interface IControllerSafety
extends ISafetyStateProvider<ControllerSafetyState>
    This interface provides access to a controller specific safety state.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      • Methods inherited from interface com.kuka.roboticsAPI.safetyModel.ISafetyStateProvider

        addSafetyStateListener, getSafetyState, removeSafetyStateListener

    • Method Detail

      • setEsmState

        void setEsmState(String name)
        Sets an ESM (Event-driven Safety Monitoring) state configured in the safety configuration.

        If the given parameter is a valid ESM name but the corresponding ESM state is not known in the safety configuration a stop category 1 is performed.

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the ESM state. Must be a numeric string between '1' and '10'.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given parameter is not a numeric string between '1' and '10'.

      • getAvailableOperationModes

        Set<com.kuka.roboticsAPI.deviceModel.OperationMode> getAvailableOperationModes()
        Returns:
        which operation modes are currently available on the controller.

      • isSmartPadConnected

        boolean isSmartPadConnected()
        Returns:
        whether a physical smartPAD device is currently connected to the controller. Will only return false if the smartPAD was properly unplugged (using the respective button).

      • resumeSafety

        void resumeSafety()
        Resumes safety.
